poem:
Title: Ode to the Interruption

There exists a chorus in the silent hall,
A symphony banished behind glass walls,
Ringing, buzzing, an unwelcome ballet,
Etiquette lost in its technological ballet,
A creature of light breaking the reverence,
A concert of interludes, dispelling the resonance,
The room fills with a silent plea,
To preserve the sacred accord of the symphony.
